ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Physical Assault
How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Sexual Assault

How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Verbal Threats

How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Theft (Person-to-person stealing)
How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Arson
How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Vandalism
How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Hate Crime
How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Hate Speech
How afraid are you about becoming a victim of any of these forms of victimization during the next year? Microaggressions (Everyday slights based on personal characteristics such as race or gender)
